availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Lavinia Carter. Father of C. Carter, N. Carter, Permelia F. Carter, William Carter, and Benjamin Carter. Farmer in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1850. Farmer in Simpson County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 59B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 881.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 16.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 297B.
Find A Grave, "Caswell Carter (7 Jul 1798-28 May 1883)," Memorial #49718810, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49718810 (accessed September 8, 2020).
